programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The North Sea With waterproof and beanie hat, Armelle's ready to take to the sea. Ostend, Saint-Idesbald, La Panne, Blankenberge... Armelle is welcomed with open arms wherever she stops. A programme as the wind blows, with a land-yacht race on the queen of the North Sea beaches. Presented by: Armelle.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Welcome to China The team arrive in the middle of the night at Ürümqi airport. There's no trace of David, the local contact. They only have two days and lots to do, including meeting the Chinese government's official escort. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
The Liberation of Paris Museum/Pierre Marty/Off-White/Plumavera.
The Liberation of Paris Museum recounts the Second World War. Chef Pierre Marty at work in the kitchens of "Ducasse sur Seine", a boat unlike any other. Off-White, with its extravagant fabrics and over-sized volumes. An in-depth look at Plumavera's exquisite expertise with feathers.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Magret de canard aux quatre baies
programme.desc: Duck breast with a four pepper sauce Pasquale Vari presents her duck breast with roast Brussels sprouts and explains how to make a four pepper sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Maison de vétéran In the middle of the 20th century, to solve the housing crisis, Canada saw the construction of tens of thousands of quick-build houses, each to the same square design: known as "wartime housing" or "maisons de vétérans". Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the French Senate, a building steeped in history. Ceramists from father to son, we meet François from the Jean Roger family. Three addresses for all fans of turntables and vinyl records. Focus on the chistera, the strange wicker glove emblematic of the Basque game of pelota. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: It's time to revise your scales and arpeggios ready for an appointment behind the scenes of the Paris Philharmonic. The youngest Michelin-starred chef in France welcomes us to her restaurant. We discover some of the well-kept gourmet secrets of Julia Sedefdjian, chef at the Baieta. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc:
A step away from infinity
The Cistercian monks of the Hauterive Abbey open their doors. In this haven of tranquillity dating back nine hundred years, they cultivate the land as they do the spirit.
Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Quick ratatouille and involtini Marc Maulà makes the most of the abundance of aubergines at the market to prepare a large quantity for freezing. On today's menu: quick ratatouille and involtini. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Thalassa
programme.desc:
Bassin d'Arcachon, along the River Leyre
We discover one of the little-known corners of the Bassin d'Arcachon: the River Leyre. Then meet the former long-distance yachtsman Yves Parlier, who has developed the concept of fitting ships with a giant sail to reduce fuel consumption.
Presented by: Sabine Quindou.

programme.title: Le drôle de drame de Marcel Carné
programme.desc:
"Le Quai des Brumes", "Hôtel du Nord", "Le Jour se Lève", "Les Visiteurs du Soir", "Les Enfants du Paradis": each an adored masterpiece, each by a film-maker who was himself little-loved, Marcel Carné (1906-1996). We look back over his career.
Directed by: François Aymé (France, 2021)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: The Mediterranean, a treasure to safeguard A rendezvous near Béziers, in the Hérault, to meet four locals, Benoît, Nicolas, Clément and Olivier, all devoted to protecting the environment. They share the reasons for their choice of profession, their motivations and commitment at work and in everyday life. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Sylvain Trabut/Génie végétal/Jardin bizarre à Étretat
programme.desc:
Programme summary: encounter with Sylvain Trabut, inventor of enchanting little woodland characters; plant engineering or environmental design that respects the natural world; fascinating and strange, the Étretat Gardens.
Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.desc: Discovery of the job of Percheron draft horse breeder at the Haras du Pin, in Orne. Encounter with Sophie, who grows ancient vegetables and edible flowers in a natural way. A company in Caen repairs IT equipment to combat overconsumption. Amandine, an influencer, gives advice on more responsible consumption. Presenter: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Flax from Delmas Canada is the world's leading flax producer. Most of the harvests are from Saskatchewan. In the small village of Delmas, Luc joins Martin Prince, an enthusiastic flax producer. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.desc:
The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them.
Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.sub-title: Huîtres dans une crème de chou-fleur au piment d'Espelette, émulsion de haddock
programme.desc: Oysters in a cauliflower cream with Espelette chili pepper, smoked haddock emulsion The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.
